description.en: The course addresses the following topics from the perspective of philosophy of science: different concepts of 'species', the questions related to biological classification, the structure of evolutionary theory, units of natural selection, the questions related to the notion of 'gene', the relevance of the questions of philosophy of biology in moral and socio-political contexts etc.
description.et: Kursusel käsitletakse bioloogiafilosoofia vaatevinklist järgmisi teemasid: erinevad liigimõisted, bioloogilise klassifikatsiooniga seotud küsimused, evolutsiooniteooria struktuur, loodusliku valiku ühikud, geeni mõistega seotud küsimused, bioloogiafilosoofia küsimuste relevantsus moraalses ja sotsiaalpoliitilises kontekstis jne.

objectives.en: The course aims to introduce the main concepts and arguments of philosophy of biology and to provide some analysis of those, as well as to develop the students' analysis and argumentation skills in the context of philosophy of biology.
objectives.et:
1. Bioloogiafilosoofia mõistete, põhiprobleemide ja argumentide
esitamine ja analüüsimine.
2. Üliõpilaste argumendianalüüsi ja argumentatsioonioskuse arendamine bioloogiafilosoofia küsimuste raames.

learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse sooritanud üliõpilane:
1) tunneb ja oskab kasutada bioloogiafilosoofia põhimõisteid,
2) tunneb põhilisi bioloogiafilosoofia teoreetilisi käsitlusi ja argumente,
3) tunneb bioloogiafilosoofia põhiprobleeme,
4) oskab bioloogiafilosoofia põhiprobleeme kriitiliselt analüüsida
ning ise (re)konstrueerida,
5) oskab end ainespetsiifiliselt väljendada nii suuliselt kui kirjalikult.

independent_work.et: Before each seminar, a student will read a text that will be discussed at the seminar. As coursework, a student has to write an essay at the end of the seminar course. If a student is absent from more than two seminars, she or he has to write summaries of the texts discussed at the seminars that she/he was absent from.

description.et: Seminar attendance and participation in the seminar discussion.
The final grade is formed on the basis of the final essay (around 3000 words long).

grade_preconditions.et: A student has to take part in seminars or has to 'compensate' them by writing summaries of the texts that were discussed.

grade_evaluation.et: The final grade is based on the final essay which is around 3000 words long, and participation in seminar discussions.

debt_elimination.et: If a student is absent from more than two seminars, she or he has to write written summaries of the texts that were discussed at the seminars that she/he was absent from.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Introduction. The basic notions of Darwinism
Materias:
Sex and Death, Chapter 2
Darwin's dangerous idea, chapter 1
Darwini ohtlik idee, peatükk 1

Adaptation and optimality   
Seminar reading:
Darwin's dangerous idea, pp. 262-282
Darwini ohtlik idee, lk 339-363
Sex and Death, chapter 10
Recommended reading:  
Dawkins, R. 'The extended phenotype' ptk. 3
Essay topics:
The arguments for and against adaptationism
Is natural selection a 'progressive' force?

Biological functions and teleology
Seminar reading:
Kitcher 'Function and design'
Neal 'Teleological Notions in Biology'
Recommended reading:
C. Allen, M. Bekoff and G. Lauders (eds.) 'Nature's Purposes' (TÜ rmtkg)
Essay topic
Does biology need different notions of 'function'?

The notion of 'innateness'
Seminar reading:
Griffiths 'What is Innateness?'
Samuels 'Is Innateness a confused concept?'

How to define life
Seminar reading:
Weber 'Life'
Benner 'Defining Life'

Evolutionary altruism and the 'gene's eye view' 
Seminar reading:
Sex and Death, chapter 3
Okasha 'Biological altruism'
Recommended reading:
Dawkins, R. 'The selfish gene'
Sober, E. 'Philosophy of biology', ptk. 4
Dawkins, R. 'The extended phenotype', ptk. 1, 5, 6.
Grafen, A. & Ridley, M.  'Richard Dawkins : how a scientist changed the way we think : reflections by scientists, writers, and philosophers'
Essay topics:
Does the 'gene eye view' help to explain the phenomenon of biological altruism?
A comparison between evolutionary and psychological altruism
NB! Seminar lükkub edasi seoses õppejõu haigestumisega.

The levels and units of natural selection 
Seminar reading:
Okasha: The units and levels of natural selection 
Recommended reading:
Williams, G. C. 'Adaptation and natural selection : a critique of some current evolutionary thought'
Dawkins, R. 'The extended phenotype', ptk. 6
Okasha, Samir 'Evolution and the levels of selection'
Essay topics:
Arguments pro and con the 'gene's eye view' of evolution
The relationship between group selection and kin selection

Laws of nature and biology
Seminar reading:
Brandon 'Does biology have laws?'
Sex and Death, pp. 364-370
Essay topics:
Can we talk about laws of nature in biology?
Are the laws of biology reducible to the laws of chemistry and physics?

The nature of biological species
Seminar reading:
Sex and Death, chapter 9
Okasha 'Darwinian metaphysics and the question of essentialism'
Recommended reading
Sober, E. 'Philosophy of biology', 6. ptk (kuni lk. 159)
Wilson, R. A. 'Species: new interdisciplinary essays'
Hearns, S & Hoekstra, R. 'Evolution', ptk. 11
Essay topics:
The advantages and disadvantages of different species concepts.
Should biology tolerate the plurality of different species concepts?

Biological classification and systematics
Seminar reading:
Sex and Death, pp. 194-201
Sober 'Philosophy of Biology', pp. 162-187
Recommended reading: 
Ereshefsky 'Systematics and Taxonomy'
Hull, D. 'Science as a process' (UT library)
Sober, E. 'Reconstructing the past' (library of ethics centre)
Ereshefsky, M. 'The poverty of the Linnaean hierarchy' (UT library)
Sober, E. 'Philosophy of biology', lk. 159-183
Hearns, S & Hoekstra, R. 'Evolution', ptk. 12
Essay topics:
The main questions concerning biological systematics and classification
Is objective biological classification possible?
The main differences between evolutionary taxonomy, pheneticism and cladism

The notion of a 'gene'
Seminar reading:
Sex and Death, chapter 6
Rheinberger, Müller-Wille, Meunier 'Gene'
Recommended reading:
Keller, E.F 'The century of the gene'
Moss, L. 'What genes can't do'
Dawkins, R. 'The extended phenotype'
Beurton, P. & Falk, R. & Rheinberger, H. 'The concept of the gene in development and evolution : historical and epistemological perspectives'
Essay topics:
The problems related to defining a 'gene'.
Can Mendelian genetics be reduced to molecular genetics?

The notion of information in biology
Seminar reading:
Godfrey-Smith, Sterelny 'Biological Information'
Recommended reading:
Keller, E.F 'The century of the gene'
Moss, L. 'What genes can't do'
Dawkins, R. 'The extended phenotype'
Beurton, P. & Falk, R. & Rheinberger, H. 'The concept of the gene in development and evolution : historical and epistemological perspectives'
Essay topic:
Can biology dispense with the notion of information?

Evolution, human behaviour and culture
Seminar reading:
Sex and Death, chapter 13
Recommended reading
Downes 'Evolutionary psychology'
E.O. Wilson 'On human nature' (in UT library)
Kitcher, P. 'Vaulting Ambition: Sociobiology and the Quest for Human Nature' (in ethics centre library)
Barkow et al. 'The adapted mind : evolutionary psychology and the generation of culture' (in UT library)
Barash, D. P. 'Sociobiology and behaviour'
Caplan, A. L. 'The sociobiology debate : readings on ethical and scientific issues'
Osbourne, E. 'Sociobiology: the new synthesis'
Laland, K. N. 'Sense & nonsense : evolutionary perspectives on human behaviour'
Essay topic:
Whether and to which extent can we apply Darwin's theory to human behaviour and human culture?

Esseeteemad

Argumendid adaptatsionismi poolt ja/või vastu
Kas looduslik valik on mingis mõttes 'progressiivne' jõud?

Kas ja milliseid erinevaid funktsioonimõisteid bioloogia vajab?

Kas 'gene's eye view' aitab seletada bioloogilist altruismi?
Evolutsioonilise ja psühholoogilise altruismi võrdlus.

Argumendid "gene's eye view" evolutsioonikäsitluse poolt ja/või vastu
Sugulasvaliku (kin selection) ja grupivaliku (group selection) omavaheline seos.

Erinevate liigimõistete eelised ja puudused.
Kas bioloogia peaks tolereerima erinevate liigimõistete pluralismi?

Kas me saame rääkida loodusseadustest bioloogias?
Kas bioloogia seadused ja seletused on redutseeritavad keemia ning füüsika seadustele? 

Bioloogilise süstemaatika ja klassifitseerimisega seotud põhiküsimused.
Kas objektiivne klassifitseerimine on võimalik?
Evolutsioonilise taksonoomia, feneetika ja kladismi põhilised erinevused.

Geeni defineerimisega seotud probleemid.
Kas Mendeli geneetikat saab redutseerida molekulaargeneetikale?

Kas bioloogia vajab informatsiooni mõistet?

Kas ja mil määral on Darwini teooria rakendatav inimkäitumisele ja -kultuurile?
Järeltöö tähtaeg. The deadline of re-submitting the essay.
